Grouped_Utterances: Well, I've been thinking a lot about my son and the custody situation. It's just so stressful.

Not really. Just the same tension with my family. They keep pushing their views on me, and I feel overwhelmed. I try to remind myself that I know what's best for my son, but it's hard when everyone else is so vocal about their opinions. Honestly, I've had some ups and downs. Some days I feel okay, but others I just feel really down like I can't get out of bed. I think it’s mostly when I think about my son. The missing him just hits me hard sometimes. I’ve tried to distract myself by watching shows or reading, but sometimes it just doesn’t work.
I feel a little calmer. It was nice to focus on something other than my worries for a moment.

I’ve been trying to journal more about my feelings, but sometimes I just end up crying instead. Mostly about my worries, like how I’m going to prove I’m a good mom. I write about my hopes for my son too. Yeah, I tend to focus on the negative things, like my fears about losing him. I don’t write enough about the positive moments. Maybe I could start each entry with something good that happened that day, no matter how small. Mindfulness can be very beneficial. Would you like to explore a simple grounding technique together?
I’d like to try to write more positively in my journal and practice the grounding exercise when I feel anxious.
